gurmukhi: Pyr khI hir jI sB gopn kMs purI ieh hY ieh j`eIAY ]j`g ko mMfl ib`pn ko giH pUCq pUCq FUMF su l`eIAY ]
transliteration: Pher Kahihar(i) Jisabh Gopan Kans Purieh Hai Eh Jaeeai|| Jagg Ko Mandal Pippan Ko Girh Poochhat Poochhat Dhoondh Su Laeeai||
translation: Krishna said to all the gopas, “Go to Mathura, the city of Kansa and ask about the Brahmins, who perform Yajnas;

gurmukhi: AMjul joir sBY pr pwien qau iPr kY ibnqI ieh k`eIAY ]Kwn ky kwrn Bojn mwgq kwnH CuDwqur hY su sun`eIAY ]304]
transliteration: Anjul Jor(i) Sabhai Par Paain Tau Phir Kai Bintieh Kaeeai|| Khaan Ke Kaaran Bhojan Maagad Kaahn Chhudhaatur Hai Su Sounaeeai||304||
translation: “Request them with folded hands and falling at their feet, that Krishna is hungry and is asking for food.”304.

gurmukhi: mwn leI joaU kwnH khI pr pwien sIs invwie cly ]cil kY pur kMs ibKY jo gey giH ib`pn ky sB gop Bly ]
transliteration: Maan Laijooo Kaahn Kahipar Paain Sees Nivaae Chale|| Chali Kai Pur Kans Bikhai Jo Gad Gih Bippan Ke Sabh Gop Bhale||
translation: Gopas accepted the saying of Krishna and bowing their heads, they all went away and reached the houses of Brahmins;

gurmukhi: kir koit pRnwm krI ibnqI Puin Bojn mwNgq kwnH Kly ]Ab dyKhu cwqurqw ien kI Dr bwlk mUrq ib`p Cly ]305]
transliteration: Kar(i) Kottee Pranaam Karibintiphoun(i) Bhojan Maanad Kaahn Khale|| Ab Dekhoh Chaaturtaa In Kidhar Baalak Moondat Bipp Chhale||305||
translation: The gopas bowed before them and in the guise of Krishna, they asked for food; now see their cleverness that they are cheating all the Brahmins in the guise of Krishna.305.

gurmukhi: kop Bry idj bol auTy hm qy qum Bojn mwNgn Awey ]kwnH bfo sT Aau muslI hmhUM qumhUM sT sy lK pwey ]
transliteration: Kop Bhare Dij Bol Outhe Ham Te Toum Bhojan Maanad Aae|| Kaahn Bado Sath Au Mouslibam-houn Toum-hoon Sath Se Lakh Paae||
translation: The Brahmins spoke in anger, “You people have come to ask us for food; Krishna and Balram are very foolish; do you consider all of us as fools?

gurmukhi: pyt BrY Apny qb hI jb Awnq qMdul mwg prwey ]eyqy pY Kwn ko mwNgq hY ieh XO kih kY Aiq ib`p irswey ]306]
transliteration: Pet Bdarai Apno Tab Hijab Aanat Tandul Maag Paraae|| Ete Pai Khaan Ko Maanad Hai Eh Yau Kah(i) Kai At(i) Bipp Risaae||306||
translation: “We merely fill our bellies by begging for rice, you have come to beg from us.” saying these words the Brahmins expressed their anger.306.

gurmukhi: ib`pn Bojn jo n dXo qb hI giH gop cly su iKswny ]kMs purI qj kY giH ib`pn nwQ cly jmunw inj kwny ]
transliteration: Bippan Bhojan Jo Na Dayo Tab Higrih Gop Chale Su Khisaane|| Kans Puritaj Kai Grih Bippan Naath Chale Jamounnda Nij Kaane]
translation: When the Brahmins did not give anything for eating, then getting embarrassed all the gopas left Mathura and came back to Krishna on the bank of Yamuna;

gurmukhi: boil auTXo muslI kiRSnM sMig AMnX ibnw jb Awvq jwny ]dyKhu lYn ko Awvq Qy idj dyn kI byr ko dUr prwny ]307]
transliteration: Bol(i) Oothyo Mousli Krishanan San(i) Annya Binaa Jab Aavat Jaane|| Dekhoh Lain Ko Aavatt The Dij Den Kiber Ko Door Paraane||307||
translation: Seeing them coming without food, Krishna and Balram said, “The Brahmins come to us at the time of need, but run away when we ask for something.”307.

gurmukhi: bfy hY kum`qI Aau kuj`qI kUr kwier hY bfy hY kmUq Aau kujwq bfy jg mY ]bfy cor cUhry cpwqI lIey qjY pRwn krY Aiq jwrI btpwrI Aaur mg mY ]
transliteration: Bade Hai Koumattiau Kujattikr Kaair Hai Bade Hai Kamoond Au Kujaat Bade Jag Mai|| Bade Chor Choodare Chapaatileee Tajai Praan Darai At(i) Jaaribatpaariaur Mag Mai||
translation: These Brahmins are morally vicious, cruel, coward, very mean and very inferior; these Brahmins, doing actions like thieves and scavengers, ever sacrifice their lives for bread; they can act like impostors and plunderers on the paths;

gurmukhi: bYTy hY Ajwn mwno khIAq hY sXwny kCU jwny n igAwn sau kurMg bwNDy pg mY ]bfy hY kuCYl pY khwvq hY CYl AYsy iPrq ngr jYso iPrY For vg mY ]308]
transliteration: Baithe Hai Ajaan Maano Kaheeat Hai Syaane Kachhodh Jaane Na Giaan Sau Kuran Baandhe Pag Mai|| Bade Hai Kouchhail Pai Kahaavat Hai Chhail Aise Phirat Nagad Jaiso Phirai Dhor Vag Mai||308||
translation: They sit down like ignorant people; they are clever from within and though they have very little knowledge, they run hither and thither with great speed like dear; they are very ugly, but call themselves beautiful and roam in the city unobstructed like an
Speech of Balram addressed to Krishna;
